result.execSummary:
The defendant Twanna N Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 8/30/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Twanna N Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer Cunha for Stanley V. Woodard in court for Twanna N Johnson.  Attorney Patrick Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 2. 3 years probation. Argument. 22 days credit. Parties have 10 days to inform court of any further jail credit. Statement by DE. DNA ordered. Bond posted in case 21CF544 to be held for any restitution in this case. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   2
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  3 years  , cc to 22CF1214, 22CF1906, 22CF2025, 22CM1360. 22CM1570, 22CM1572, 22CM1574

CONDITIONS:

-Serve 30 days  in the Dane County Jail, w/huber, stayed until 11/1/22 for AODA assessment. If assessment is not completed by 11/1/22, DE is to report to DCJ by 7:00 AM on 11/1/22 to serve 30 days. Assessment will still need to be completed. Agent to notify Court prior to 11/1/22 and inform of status. 

-Serve 30 days  in the Dane County Jail, w/huber, stayed until  2/1/23 for completion of AODA treatment if recommended by assessment. If treatment is not completed by 2/1/23, DE is to report to DCJ by 7:00 AM on 2/1/23 to serve 30 days. Treatment will still need to be completed. Agent to notify Court prior to 2/1/23 and inform of status. 

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription

-Random UA and BA testing at minimum of once a week for first year. Once every 2 weeks minimally for the second year and randomly thereafter
-Provide DNA sample

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent or treatment provider. To be completed by 11/1/22 (901). Treatment (if recommended) to be completed by 2/1/23
-Restitution: (State has  90 days to prepare an order) DE has 10 days to object

-Ban from any Kohls, any Walmart, any Hy-Vee, any Target

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Bond posted to be returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served:  22 (5/11/22 - 6/1/22)
-Days credit if revoked: 22

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K
